Topic: Draw animals in their habitats with labels (e.g., fish in water).
Evidence Statements: The student can draw different plants and animals, including humans, in their natural habitats.
The student can label the places where the different plants and animals live (e.g., trees, rivers, fields).
The student can show and label the resources that plants and animals need to survive (e.g., water for fish, leaves for deer, sunlight for plants).
The student can illustrate the relationship between animals and their habitats (e.g., fish live in water, deer live in the forest).
The student can represent how plants and animals meet their needs in different environments (e.g., fish swimming in water, plants growing in sunny places).
The student can demonstrate how the environment provides the necessary resources for plants and animals through their drawing.
